website_summaries.verdict: The C9 features an upgraded processor and even thinner design than its predecessor, making it a worthwhile upgrade.
pros: The latest OLED TV from LG features a vivid display that is available in three sizes: 55”, 65”, and 77”
Rich sound produced when this TV is paired with a sound bar
The inclusion of both Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa is convenient
While the contrast and image clarity are impressive, where this TV shines is its smooth video thanks to the Gen 2 processor and fast refresh rate
cons: Some customers have experienced burn-in issues

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the oled bandwagon for some time. Each year LG make it just a little bit better. +HDMI 2.1 is a big plus. +1.3ms input lag for gaming +Autocal (calman) - the TV has a built in pattern generator. (saving $1500 in the calibration process.) Burn-in is a non-issue -cost (It is worth it to me, but more than other TVs) -I wish i had more money to get the 77"
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Zielin

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box started using it and noticed a black dot, then another and another and another. The entire screen is peppered with dead pixels.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit
customer_reviews.text: After a few setup screens the TV turned itself off. Turning it back on, it only stayed on for about ten seconds while trying to get through the setup screens again. Plugged into different outlet same result: TV would power off after 10 seconds. Even after going through steps with an LG rep on the phone. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ritepath

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for a day
customer_reviews.text: Had a black line in middle of the screen called lg they said it would need to be replaced apparently it is a common issue
customer_reviews.author: william alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, software is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Had this TV a couple weeks. Picture is great. Software is totally broken. Constantly have to input my wifi password, logon to my streaming services, run back and forth to my computer to "register" the TV with Amazon Prime every time I watch anything. The TV's software will remember nothing. Thought maybe there was an update that would fix this, but no dice. Going to get an upgraded ROKU with 4K and then never touch LG's idiotic software again. Would give it five stars if LG's software wasn't such a screeching pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lagomorphius

customer_reviews.title: Are there 6 stars?
customer_reviews.text: We had a Vizio UHD. It was a good tv. I had issues with the Vizio tv working with the Vizio sound bar. This LG...my god it's near perfection. The balance of black to brightness lets me see things that had been too dark previously. Clarity is amazing! LG store has all the apps I want (Vizio wouldn't give me spotify, bummer). This is the best TV I've ever seen. Everything looks more clear- we stream Amazon, hulu and Netflix, no cable. The LGTV option has a variety of free channels (i.e., the History channel which is cool).
customer_reviews.author: Layne Moore

customer_reviews.title: If you want to use this for your PC, DON’T!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this TV for the sole purpose of grading my footage with it. But, my PC screen won’t work properly with it. It’ll show up for a few minutes, blocked by a message on the tv about “Ultra HD deep color”, then my screen disappears when I press “ok”...and ‘no signal’ shows up. Guess what happens if I don’t press ‘Ok’...that’s right, my screen still disappears. I’ve had $200 TVs connect to my PC with ZERO issues. So, I expect a $1500 TV to connect even more flawlessly...which this piece of junk does not. I’m LESS than completely dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing TV. My only complaint, which is very minor, is that the audio outputs are limited, and the signal at the output is low
customer_reviews.author: phastdoc

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the first new TV I've bought in 12 years. It was probably the worst decision I have made. I have since purchased a $400 65'' TCL and I'm 200% more satisfied with it. If you want something that "just works" , don't waste your money. Otherwise enjoy spending lots of time with setup, color calibration, home theatre configuration and more. Not to mention the obvious additional anxiety of burn-in and dead pixels. Do yourself a favor and get a regular ol' tried and true LED TV and stop worrying!
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Great picture. But very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Picture is great sound is great but I have to re connect my phone just to airplay every time. I wanted this tv because I can download apps but you cannot download espn, hbo plus and many more. It’s difficult to navigate and takes forever for anything to load. My internet speed are over +160mpbs so it’s not the internet speed. It’s very frustrating and slow
customer_reviews.author: Lance W.

customer_reviews.title: Defected return shipping problem!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son for Christmas present after a few days stopped working. He called for tech support they couldn’t help told him to return it. unfortunately he got rid of box. Was instructed to take to ups store to ship back. They charged him for boxing. If he could have taken to Kohl’s they do not charge for boxing . So it cost my son 72 dollars for gift from me.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Ferriss

customer_reviews.title: The best TV I've owned
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find fault with the C9. Even if you don't like any of the out of box settings, they are all adjustable, some to incredibly minute details. Our is in a bright room and is not at all hard to see on the sunniest days. Highlights: Black levels are amazing. Upscaling of HD and SD content is excellent. Menu system is very speedy and intuitive to navigate. Built-in apps load nearly immediately - fastest I've seen in any TV or box. Minor criticisms: At this price I'd expect a backlit remote. The audio on the set is nothing to get excited about, but I use a soundbar most of the time anyway, so it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: WMH

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic TV
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to switch to OLED after watching the Witcher on Netflix because I was tired of seeing grayish blobs in dark scenes. OLEDs aren't the brightest TVs but think with the deep blacks the HDR scenes pop more than the brightest TVs on the market. I played a few games on it, both on PC and PS4, and the super low input lag made for a great experience. I'd give it a 4/5 for gaming just because of the risk of burn-in. Just be safe with playing or watching anything with static images. One last thing, make sure you turn off TruMotion to get rid of the soap-opera effect.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This LG OLED55C9PUA is simply great! Until my son came to visit the past two weeks I had no idea how advanced the LG brand had become. When he showed me all the features and entertainment at the palm of my hand and the LG magic remote I could hardly believe it. One of the best personal purchases I have made in years. Beautiful colors, clear and precise. Clear and understandable Dolby audio even for my hearing aids. Spectacular channel and entertainment of all types that are far too many to describe. Bought this LG during Amazon Prime Days. So glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: James .

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture! All metal construction. Speakers are surprisingly decent.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 55". The picture is simply amazing. Black is truly black. I had been debating for a while between a LG OLED or a Samsung QLED. Really glad I didn't compromise on the picture quality for a slightly lower price. It is absolutely worth the money and more!
customer_reviews.author: Toco Toucan

customer_reviews.title: Rating just for delivery- TV not out of box yet
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to write this, even before I open the box. The delivery service was THE WORST i've had. No phone call to let me know when they were arriving (supposed to call 30min before). Just one person to carry the heavy 90lb box into the elevator and to my unit. I asked where his dolly was, he said broken. He had that TV box turned every which way but the way it should have been. He left it on the floor where I asked, but upside down. I didn't see it until he left and the "This side up was on the floor". We'll see how the TV is when we open the box up... It better work perfectly..
customer_reviews.author: A. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: 4K@120 fps verified
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful picture and the gaming is top notch. 4K@120 fps using my son's gaming PC. The C9 55 Inch is definitely the best gaming TV and the movies are out of this world.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Finally a worthy replacement to the almighty plasma
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant when I decided to replace my Panasonic zt65 plasma. I read about the refresh rate not being up to plasma standards. I can tell you the image is by far more vibrant then plasma or any tv I’ve seen in store displays. You can use multiple setting to reduce to an almost undetectable level the motion blur. Our other tv is a Sony 85inch 950 and the motion blur is almost unbearable. I would definitely recommend this tv. Especially after seeing that the lg cx 2020 model is the identical tv minus 3 features. The blacks are true to life, the user interface is great and well Executed. Would recommend and buy again Thanks LG
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture quality. Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This TV replaces a 4 year old smart TV. The LG TV has all the technologies that you may think off. Excellent picture quality, excellent remote control and extremely easy set up. You don’t need Amazon Fire anymore. Truly smart TV. Sound quality is ok so you will need a sound bar. The remote control works like a mouse which makes your life easier browsing between moves and channels. Picture quality is something that I have never seen before. It is also $500 cheaper than the equivalentSamsung QLED TV.
customer_reviews.author: bebo

customer_reviews.title: This years best TV gets even better with G-Sync
customer_reviews.text: I love the picture quality on this OLED. The picture is bright, has inky blacks and has some of the lowest input lag you will see on a TV. LG and Nvidia worked together recently to release new firmware that alows G-SYNC when connected to an Nvidia Video Card. One very cool feature is that auto game mode, as soon as you start gaming the TV will switch to a mode to minimize input lag. It's a nice feature to have as you don't have to do anything to manually switch modes. Do not hesitate to get this TV. It's a heck of a TV.
customer_reviews.author: TWISM

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Could not finish setting up the TV because the screws required to assemble the base did not fit. Tried LG customer service but they were of little help informing me they would send new screws in 7 to 10 days (and then, what if it is not the screws but a poorly machined base?). When one pays over a couple grand for a "flagship" TV model, better service should be expected. Back to Amazon - no more LG. I'll just stick with my reliable, old standard - Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Bill T.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing!!! This TV definitely lives up to the hype in terms of image quality. Obviously 4K content is what makes it stand out. Setup was fairly easy for one person. Be sure to install both the sound base and main base. I made the mistake of installing only the main base which resulted in the TV having a slight lean. Once the sound plate was put in, the leaning stopped. It is quite heavy and I would recommend two people if you need to lift the TV onto a TV bench/stand. I looked at the Samsung and Sony XBR as well. LG’s faster OS and OLED picture quality sold me. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: It's ok I was expecting more
customer_reviews.text: The LG C9 seems like a well made television however I was expecting more and the construction of the tv although sturdy in the base seems a bit flimsy on the actual panel, I am also not a fan of how they decided to do the vesa mounting in the back as the tv now sit higher than normal tvs because the mounting holes as not centered to the tv but are rather low position closer to the base
customer_reviews.author: STEFHEN

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: When I first hooked up this TV, I was amazed by the vibrancy of the colors. Three months later and the screen "crashes" every time it is turned on for 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Smart TV....
customer_reviews.text: Great picture but just too many options. If you are a streaming savvy, electronics geek then this is for you. However, if you like simple and straight-forward operation, this may have too many "whistles and bells".
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: Less than 48 hours and there's already damage on the screen, a 3in wide vertical line appeared on the screen and wont away even after numerous pixel refreshes as told by LG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement over what I had before.
customer_reviews.text: Went through a lot of reviews and TV shopping before settling on this model. My parents have some Samsung smart TVs which I do like and have been comparing this TV to since I started using it. It seemed much more smooth working within the features on this TV from apps to picture settings. It is not as bright as the Samsungs, but part of why I purchased this TV is because I noticed the brightness from the Samsung was washing it some of the details and I prefer to see as much detail as possible which this model provides. I can't speak for the sound as I use a Vizio surround set-up. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SpacePiratePhD

customer_reviews.title: Won’t price protect , stupid policy
customer_reviews.text: Buy from a place that will price protect you for falling prices. Bought this tv price down $499 2weeks later. They told me to return it and reorder . So stupid. TV is nice though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is unbelievable. It’s hard to watch on any other TV after seeing this. The UI is snappy. There is some room for improvement. The remote has buttons for Prime Video and Netflix even though I prefer YouTube which does not have a button. The setup process was kind of a pain because the tv is very fragile. It included an IKEA-style diagram with no words that I could not decipher for the life of me, so I had to set up the stand twice to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Best tv I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I received this LG OLEDC965PUA a few days ago and I absolutely love it. The picture quality is the best I’ve ever seen. Smart tv features are outstanding. The magic remote is a pleasure to use. I highly recommend this tv to anyone looking for the best tv available. Thanks also to amazon for great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: LAT

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous picture but makes a loud noise during bright scenes.
customer_reviews.text: Tv looks gorgeous but started to notice that it made a noise that you can hear over the sound bar when there is a bright screen (mostly white background or during some games like madden 2020 which you can hear it consistently) after some research my tv has something called Coil Whine which seems to be pretty common. It’s very frustrating. Will resubmit review after I find a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Troman55

customer_reviews.title: By far the best TV I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best TV I've ever seen! Epic for movies, great for sports and games. Streaming is even better too! Thank you LG!
customer_reviews.author: Late 60s nerd

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I can't get over how this machine performs. I plugged it in and hooked up with my outdoor antenna, turned it on and it already created a list of stations, including descriptions of everything including future shows. The picture is the finest Ever. I don't how they will make a TV better than this. You might ditch your ROKO too, I did because the TV works as good and iit works with your TV Remote which has a pointer
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the way the item was shipped and protected. Very pleased with the easiness of putting together the stand. It does take two people (at our age) to lift it out of the box and onto the counter. Very pleased with the appearance, sound, color and overall quality of this TV. Now...what to do with the old TV.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal picture, intuitive interface
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the picture on this TV is great, certainly the best I've ever seen. I've never liked the "smart tv" apps and interfaces I've used from years ago and always replaced it with an Apple TV that was more enjoyable to use. The interface and navigation on this TV is a significant improvement from others I've used in the past and directly being able to use AirPlay is quite convenient. I still have an Apple TV attached for the aggregation of content, but I find myself using the TVs features directly quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The blacks are so black it is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I went with 65 inches and I am glad I spent the extra cash. Delivery was perfect and it was easy to setup and attach to my wall mount. It took about 30 minutes max. The hardest part is how to carry it given it is so thin and does not have the same kind of frame as my 8 year old TV it replaced. I think blu-rays look great and most things are upvert nicely. Keep in mind the up-vert to 4K may be happening BEFORE the LG gets a chance, e.g. the 4K UHD player, FIreTV stick ( not confirmed), and even a receiver that might be in the middle. Just something to think about.
customer_reviews.author: Toby J. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Fullscreen Brightness is a Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: This TV will automatically dim the screen if you display majority white (such as fullscreen web browsing during page loads) or bright scenes in movies/films where the majority of the screen becomes bright. This creates a sense of flickering or uneven display, and there are no options to disable the behavior. While this may be acceptable or even possible to ignore in a less expensive TV, uneven or uncontrollable picture quality issues are unacceptable in a TV this expensive. If you're looking to spend this much on a TV, buy something else. And if this problem doesn't sound like an issue, find something less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: blackraen

customer_reviews.title: OK so far but the OLED image to me is not worth the 4X price over a standard HD LG
customer_reviews.text: Mounted the 65” unit on the wall with no problem but that thin screen did require extra care. Mount the wall unit bracket to the TV first to help you lift and maneuver the unit using the bracket. I am worried about burn in as it happened to a 3 year old LG LCD. Cannot say that the OLED image is that much better than my other LG LCD given the 4X cost difference.
customer_reviews.author: Fhteacher

customer_reviews.title: Best 4K picture quality experience!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is outstanding. The best I have seen. Old shows are new again. It feels like I've crawled out of a cave and we're skipping fire and wheel and going straight to TV. Good picture! Definite 4K experience. I moved the component by myself with no issues. Attached and used stand, slow and carefully. Just a beautiful TV. Good UI.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McKelvey

customer_reviews.title: Great TV but...
customer_reviews.text: The new LG 65" OLED is a fine TV with picture quality and perfect brightness. I would have given 5 stars but for the remote. A pricey TV comes with a substandard remote control that does not work smoothly which requires multiple attempts to change channels. The controls for volume and channels are black on black background makes it difficult to see at night. Lastly, I don't use TV for gaming therefore not rated.
customer_reviews.author: JVM

customer_reviews.title: Best TV you can get
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is the best yet. One thing I really like is LG kept the RF sensor and functionality so users could use their all in one remotes such as the Harmony remotes. Unlike Samsung’s upper level models which are controlled with Bluetooth only remotes so many times you need several remotes to control your system. The one thing I don’t like is both LG and Samsung eliminated their analog audio output port.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Great TV! Closest to Plasma!
customer_reviews.text: The TV is great. 65” is little bigger than I anticipated. Also if you have an older receiver without eARC like I do then you are going to need to set your receiver up to encode the PCM signal back to 5.1 surround sound. If you are coming from a plasma and want the picture to look similar then you need to turn trumotion off and make sure de-judder and de-blur off. Works great with games, live sports and old 1080p content.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: wonderful picture
customer_reviews.text: first off it was fairly straight forward set up, and I have been very happy with the picture and responsiveness. I can say that I have not had it professional calibrated but it has been pleasing to my eye so far but I may have it done in the future, the menus are a little clunky but everything has its quirks and overall I can pretty easily find what I need. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: jhh

customer_reviews.title: If you are unsure if you want to get? Just get it, trust me!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best TV I’ve ever purchased. I was on the fence at first because I was going to wait for the 2020 releases to see what LG had to offer. I am so glad I didn’t wait! Plus I got it at a good price. Picture quality is 10/10 and I haven’t had any issues with the brightness of the TV either. This is my first OLED TV I also own a SUHD LG TV from 2018 and the the OLED blows it out the water by so much! It’s true what they say, once you go OLED you won’t go back. I don’t think I’ll ever purchase another tv that isn’t OLED.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Mencia

customer_reviews.title: It's paid for!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this TV on a Monday. Was supposed to get it Wed. BUT! For some reason, the Amazon credit card I've been using wouldn't work. I had to call my bank in order for it to be sent. So I got it Friday. It's beautiful!, great picture. I have DirectTV, and they only have one 4K ch now. That's 104. Did get to watch the super bowl in 4K Had to pay a $99 upgrade charge. I'd buy it again! RR
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Worth all the hype
customer_reviews.text: about the deep-black and the clarity. I could immediately tell the difference. Standard setting was bright, way too bright; so, I turned it down a bit. Just hope it will last as long as our previous SamSung TV. Oh, one note about the assembly: it would seem very simple and intuitive but we weren't quite up to it, even a couple of college grads I'm ashamed to say. Went to the well and drank from YouTube. First, lay the heavy base at an incline against one of the styrofoams. Slide the long horizontal piece into the base and screw it in. Then, it will be fairly obvious how to fit the entire base onto the TV itself.
customer_reviews.author: groundie

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: The OLED stories are true: the picture quality surpasses that of the latest LCD models--and is undeniably the best that you can get right now. Also, the user interface on this model is very straightforward; and the TV is HDMI 2.1-compatible so will not be outdated for years to come. It's substantially more expensive than an LCD of the same size, but I completely forgot this when I watched it for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Pigg

customer_reviews.title: Very Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful TV for our small living room. I wanted a 65, my wife thought a 55” would be better. I have to say she was right, picture quality, brightness with sun coming in the window is wonderful. I’ll probably never figure it all out, but there are some very good YouTube videos on it to help you through any problems. We are extremely happy with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Gamer Here
customer_reviews.text: I use to his tv for mostly PC gaming, or a second monitor. I upgraded from a 2011 1080p LG (with 36k hours on it, and zero problems) and couldn't be happier. I do not notice any input lag (this tv is about as low as you can go, for TV's in milliseconds, lg 65c9pua), stuck pixels, or burn in. To tell you it's an upgrade is a no brainier, from what I had, but I must say worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Salty Soldier

customer_reviews.title: Buy this TV
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this purchase. Picture quality and brightness are a huge step above TVs even from OLEDs from just a couple of years ago. The blacks and picture contrast are fantastic and the remote, user interface, and smart TV apps are well thought through. Better than my old Samsung. Very happy with this TV
customer_reviews.author: Foman123

customer_reviews.title: BEST TV on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to keep this review short and sweet. If you value picture quality and have the ability to splurge a little, BUY THIS TV! Don't even bother considering a QLED. The picture quality of this set is AMAZING, especially when streaming 4K content from Netflix, Amazon, etc. If you don't believe me, just Google and read the reviews. There is absolutely no judder which you may find in LED TVs. It also contains the full suite of apps (e.g., Netflix, Prime Video, YouTube, Apple+, Disney+, YouTube, Spotify, etc.) which makes this a true smart TV. Absolutely the BEST TV money can buy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chan

customer_reviews.title: The best decision I ever made
customer_reviews.text: A truly magnificent television in every way. Build quality. Thinness, and near lack of any bezel. Insane contrast. HDR that really shows what a massive difference it makes. A great, snappy OS. I can't find a thing to complain about. Yes, it was expensive, but this is a dream TV, and I'm convinced it was worth every penny. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great but issues with HDMI ports
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic picture quality. Probably the best tv for the money on the market today (except for last year's model that is $1,000 cheaper). I purchased this TV about 6 weeks ago and twice so far the HDMI1 port has become non-responsive. The message says no signal from my cable box, but moving the HDMI plug to HDMI3 I can see my cable signal is fine. The solution I found online is to power off the TV, unplug everything and wait 30 minutes. I have concerns that this might become permanent and who knows how long until they all stop working. It hasn't been a problem on HDMI2 (my roku stick). Aside from this, the TV would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered new. Got return.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken with cracked screen. Miasing remote and screws to bolt the stand. **definitely a returned item** Ordered a new item!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The best TV for games!
customer_reviews.text: I did a good analysis of this TV because it works very well in everything but unfortunately I found a burned pixel ten days after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: johan velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Best quality picture I've ever seen on a TV
customer_reviews.text: This is, without a doubt, the best quality picture I have ever seen on a TV. I would gladly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing image and technology.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tv. The clarity, color, quality of picture is incredible. Worth upgrading to.
customer_reviews.author: Big Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Annoying blurry picture
customer_reviews.text: When powering on, the picture is extremely blurry. After about 30 seconds, it clears up. Then, it randomly goes from clear to blurry. I’ve tried every troubleshooting suggestion with no luck. When it’s clear, it’s awesome. But, the blur times is extremely frustrating especially considering how much this TV cost.
customer_reviews.author: White Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Mindblowing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pair with new Nvidia RTX card and replace Sony Bravia 4K. Bought the card before the tv and I thought the card would be the more important part of the equation. Boy was I wrong. The Gsync for 120hz, the HDR implementation, the picture quality in literally every aspect. Mind blowing. And the TV I had before wasn't a slouch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far love this TV
customer_reviews.text: This TV is amazing and an absolutely treat to watch. Note you should change the settings to Cinema mode if you are watching movies that are 24 fps.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S

customer_reviews.title: The tv stand spans the width of the tv and sits low, so Cant run boxes or sound bars in front of tv
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a new tv in 12 years. I was in love with my plasma. But unfortunately, I needed something bigger for my giant living room. So I hesitantly upgraded. I did a bit of research and landed on this beauty. The picture is awe inspiring (sorry plasma!) and the design is very sleek. I love it. I’m only a week in but will update with any developments.
customer_reviews.author: RRW81

customer_reviews.title: DELIGHTED
customer_reviews.text: This TV has THE BEST picture - really happy with it as well as the overall appearance of the unit. The built in speaker is adequate although I did hook up a sound system. Super easy to set up - intuitive to use..........a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki36243

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture
customer_reviews.text: Best picture we’ve ever had, but I’m not as smart as my smart TV and don’t find the controls intuitive. Just me, though. A young person would probably have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Porterfield

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PIX  but ..........
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions are pictures only and one step is NOT clear at all. I almost stripped out one of the 4 (only) base mounting screws before I figured it out. My HUGE complaint is with the remote control. It is IMPOSSIBLE for me to understand or use it at all. I paired it with my DirecTV box and use ONLY that remote. I can not, nor will not, do anything else with this TV> Love the picture to death and the sound is well done as well. Wish I could use the remote to add a touch of base to the sound, but I am old and a tech-no Luddite!
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Garrity

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size  & Height
customer_reviews.text: Great tv. The picture is very clear, we love the smart features, The one button connect to Netflix and to Amazon Prime are very handy. The remote pointer makes easy adding of usernames and passwords. We watch from about 8 to 10 feet away and size works well.
customer_reviews.author: Stew

customer_reviews.title: Great tv, poor remote
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, easy setup. IR remote is very hard to get used to. I don’t like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: K. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this TV a few days, but so far I’m very impressed with the picture quality. Vibrant colors and exceptional contrast. The 4K content I have watched has had outstanding clarity and the refresh rate seems just fine. The setup is a little cumbersome with the creation of an account and logging into all of the “smart” apps and features. But once you are past this it is a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: TxEngr

customer_reviews.title: Super thin and easy to mount
customer_reviews.text: Nice picture quality. Not quite sure that I've managed to get it connected to Alexa or Google for voice command. That process is a little complex and glitchy. Outside of that, I'm very pleased with this purchase. LG said that it came with a year's subscription to Disney+. Made my submission for that and still waiting to get a response from them. It's been more than the 28 days they said it would take to get a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Clubb

customer_reviews.title: This TV is crazy good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this TV mainly to use with a PC as it now supports G-Sync. After getting everything setup I am actually amazed how well this TV works as a computer monitor.. still have to keep in mind a potential of long term burn in.. but wow.. I would say it is better than any actual PC monitor I've used.. and I've used quite a few. Highly Recommended if you want to game with your PC and always wanted the benefits of OLED. It will only get better too once Nvidia releases HDMI 2.1 video cards and we can get 4k@120hz!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Overall, beautiful picture quality and G-Sync works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Biggest selling point was the G-Sync support, which works flawless with my rig. Picture quality is beautiful especially when watching 4k shows. My biggest problem with this tv is that the power cord is hard wired into the TV. This means that if that cord is ever damage it's going to be a hassle to replace, since the whole tv needs to be sent in for repairs. Also the length of the cord is a problem, if you plan on connecting farther than 5 to 6 feet you'll require a extension cord. Chromecast isn't built in as well which is disappointing. Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ponce

customer_reviews.title: Love ❤️ it.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about my TV. It has a great picture and is very user friendly. I feel like I got a big beautiful giant fast computer on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Mister Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Television
customer_reviews.text: I work in visual effects so I have a very strict eye for good color and great black levels. This is absolutely the best quality television for the money that available right now. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: LG OLED55C9PUA Alexa Built-in C9 Series 55" 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV (2019)
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is Wow! The picture quality is outstanding. I was so surprised at how thin it is (see photo). Its easy to set up. The volume sounds good even without a sound system. This is an amazing TV. I will buy the 65" version for our living room when our house is completed.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: I like amazon did a good job with delivery. I dislike that the tv developed a whole vertical line of dead pixels less than 3 days out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Price

customer_reviews.title: What a TV
customer_reviews.text: Had some slide show on a dvd that I took and edited. They never looked this good on the TV. Took a little to learn the controls to get from one HDMI to another but now everything is super. I found a few 4k movies and felt I was right there with the camerman plus Blu-ray movies also look great on this tv.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Burazin

customer_reviews.title: A1 picture
customer_reviews.text: Best picture I have ever owned I have it in a system with a Denon Receiver and the latest Roku
customer_reviews.author: Charles Michael Rios

customer_reviews.title: Quick refresh rate, great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Very clear, and has been awesome for video games. No issues with burn in, for most games I will turn off the HUD if playing for extended periods of time
customer_reviews.author: Eric N

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is excellent. Arguably the best consumer oled panel out there. Although pricey I do not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marv

customer_reviews.title: puts our Samsung LED to shame...
customer_reviews.text: TV is amazing and there is nothing better for the price. Brightness isn't quite a good as our previous Samsung LED tv but the OLED picture on the LG blows the Samsung away. TV is also AWESOME for console AND PC gaming. Hooked up my PC to the TV and was playing Apex Legends at 100+ fps with no lag at all. Also has G Sync support for Nvidia Cards. This is THE TV to get if you are into gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great picture & good price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a 2019 model LG 55" OLED to replace our almost 20 year old Pioneer Elite plasma 50". Excellent picture quality & the LG OS is very easy to navigate. Finally enjoying being able to stream content with our first smart TV :)
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing just simply amazing..
customer_reviews.text: This has to be so far the best 4K tv I have used. The built in surround sound is amazing. The picture quality is awesome. 65" is big enough to see every little detail. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Milner

customer_reviews.title: Great television. Had to Return due Bad Screen
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 1-2 days but then lines developed across the screen. Not sure if it was a defect or if it occurred in shipping. Was able to get a refund & will get another one in the near future. However, I think it will be better to pick one up in case having it shipped was the cause. I thought 1 Star was not fair since i only had it a short time & was given a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Best investment you can make for a tv
customer_reviews.text: This tv is amazing!! Best 4K picture. Good for gaming or movie night. It is not recommended to keep this tv left on one for a long time period, as this can cause image burn.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Kaltenmark

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful high definition with one flaw in the remote
customer_reviews.text: I love this TV. The picture quality is crisp and infallible. I love that the TV is thin. The only downside is the remote. It’s missing a key feature for me which is a button that goes to the last channel viewed. That’s a huge flaw in my opinion. But the TV itself is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fern

customer_reviews.title: Great TV, good price
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, thin, bright clear picture. Also, I purchased the installation. Both transactions and delivery seamless. Totally pro installer. Great experience all around. I ❤️ Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine but now have a line
customer_reviews.text: This TV was wall mounted since day one and had no problems but now two months later from when I purchased it a line has appeared on the display and won’t disappear even with a pixel refresh... disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Khan

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV from Amazon Warehouse, which should be checked by Amazon before shipped. However, TV arrived not working. It was a total bummer on SuperBowl date. Never trust Amazon Warehouse ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Emre Perk

customer_reviews.title: Unmatched quality of Picture
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The most realistic picture of any flat screen we've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Gulick

customer_reviews.title: Best TV On The Market
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge audio/video guy and have always purchased the best electronics. I just got my 55" LG OLED for Christmas and it did not disappoint. It literally looks better than any TV I've seen, save for maybe the Sony OLED which is twice the price. Superb picture quality and a very easy to use menu/OS.
customer_reviews.author: John Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good TV. The picture is outstanding. I bought this TV based on my son's recommendation. He had bought the 55 inch model. The setup was very easy to follow. I was up and running within the hour. I had problems with my Yamaha receiver with the sound due to the HDMI was turned off in the receiver options. So check your home theater options before starting.
customer_reviews.author: Ted C.

customer_reviews.title: Great tv but you need two people to set up and to hang.
customer_reviews.text: The clarity of the picture...blades of grass, and the color is rich. 55 inches is plenty for single or family viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Jana S.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the 55” 2019 model for about 10 days. The picture quality is superior. The sound is very good. The built in Alexa compatibility is worthless. Nothing within the Alexa app or the LG app makes any difference. Alexa will answer general questions but can not control the tv.
customer_reviews.author: drsw

customer_reviews.title: Get an OLED
customer_reviews.text: The best TV for gaming and entertainment. Just get an OLED TV.
customer_reviews.author: K.G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 4k T.V. for everything
customer_reviews.text: Epic! This TV is mind blowing. I was expecting a pretty big step up from my old 1080p LG and this exceeded my expectations. I hooked up my pc to this TV to try out G-sync on it and it was buttery smooth. I have tried watching movies, sports, UHD streaming and gaming in 4k on this TV and the clarity is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TV OK
customer_reviews.text: liked the tv the picture is very clear color great. The price was good and delivery was good. we do miss the old one we had since it had 3D on it no matter what you watched. this one is good.
customer_reviews.author: Moonpath

customer_reviews.title: Impressive.
customer_reviews.text: It is expensive but if you can afford it, you should buy it. The picture quality and HDR are amazing. If you are a gamer with NVidia graphics, you will also benefit from Gsync and the relatively high refresh rate.
customer_reviews.author: RRH

customer_reviews.title: More than satisfied with this tv!
customer_reviews.text: Great picture in HD or 4K UHD. I would recommend connecting it to a 4K capable sound system for optimum performance. Why buy a tv of this quality without quality sound?
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This TV is great. A bit pricy, but worth it
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: What's to dislike?
customer_reviews.text: I like this television. It's got a great picture and very good sound. The remote takes a bit of getting used to. Powers up very fast and shuts down in a blink. 4k is incredible when available.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great TV made even better with Apple HomeKit and AirPlay 2 updates
customer_reviews.text: New firmware updates added HomeKit and AirPlay 2 compatibility - which works like a charm. Make sure to turn off smooth gradation. Great picture and easy to tweak the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

product_meta.title: LG C9 Series Smart OLED TV - 65" 4K Ultra HD with Alexa Built-in, 2019 Model
product_meta.description: Size:65-Inch| Style:TVOnce you've watched your favorites on an LG OLED TV, every other television falls short Whether it’s movies, shows, sports or gaming, Perfect Black and infinite contrast bring out rich color and clear detail. LG's most powerful 4K processor, α9 Gen 2 Intelligent Processor, enhances everything you watch. Picture and sound are elevated with premium Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos. Plus LG AI TV is the world's most intelligent TV with LG ThinQ AI and the voice control of the Google Assistant* and Alexa built-in. *Service limited to certain languages. Some features require 3rd party service subscriptions.
feature_bullets: LG A9 Gen 2 Intelligent Processor: Images, action and color are brought to new life to instantly enhance picture quality through LG's best 4K processor, empowered by AI at its core
LG THINQ, Alexa and Google Assistant: LG TVs are the first to integrate both the Google Assistant and Alexa with LG ThinQ AI technology

DOLBY Vision AND DOLBY ATMOS: Transform your TV into an entertainment powerhouse Advanced image and sound technologies inspired by the cinema optimize picture and sound for a spectacular, more lifelike experience in every scene; The ultra vivid picture and powerful, moving audio seem to flow all around you
NVIDIA G SYNC Compatibility: exceptional picture quality of perfect black and intense colors combine with smooth gameplay to take PC gaming to new heights

WISA Speaker Compatibility: works seamlessly to deliver high fidelity in wireless audio; It dramatically elevates the cinematic sound of everything you watch; Only supports 5.1 Channel and 2.0 Channel; Transmitter dongle required and sold separately
Airplay 2: with Airplay 2 built in, you can effortlessly cast anything from Apple iPhone or laptop to your LG AI TV

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars869 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
